page.title: 04Hop Growing in Brenchley
page.content: At Tibbs Court Farm 80 acres of hops are grown in{hop gardens.}A framework of chestnut poles about 12ft. high supports wires.In Spring hop stringers perform this rural craft, using a pole or{wearing stilts}they fasten string to the overhead wires and down to a wire twist in the ground by each hop plant,forming a regular pattern. Several shoots are encouraged to grow up the strings then a spray is applied at ground level to prevent further shoots developing.The plants grow to the top wires and flower late in the summer.The hops are gathered in September when full of pollen which gives beer and lager it's flavour. The stems of the plants are{cut by {hand}from a high platform on a tractor {10 farm workers and 50 extra pickers bring the crop in.The hops are taken in trailers to be separated and dried.
